title: RBI says banks' group entities cannot be used to circumvent norms
description: India's central bank mandates that group entities of banks cannot bypass parent guidelines for restricted business activities. Banks need RBI's prior approval for new group activities. No bank can hold over 30% of equity in any company with its group entities. Small finance banks and payments banks must follow licensing conditions.
